page.title: 12INTERESTING PEOPLE, 2.
page.content: We also interviewed our grand-parents. They went to schools, a few of which are still open, e.g. Victoria and Northchurch. Many left at the age of 14. Some lived on farms and still remember the pony and traps carrying the milk churns. They said that nearly all the shops had changed and that many of the new housing estates were built on what was once open fields. The station is still the same, but the trains are now electric, instead of steam! Fashion has changed many times and the women remember long dresses and all of them wore hats. When they were young, they would cook on open grates. They had oil lamps, or candles, then gas lamps, then electricity. Entertainment was found through listening to early radios.
